sentence: What do you call a sea mammal with a mission? a porpoise.
first_new_sentence: The researchers observed the porpoise swimming alongside the boat.
second_new_sentence: The porpoise of this exercise is to enhance our understanding of marine life.

sentence: Why was the snowman smiling? ...he saw a snowblower coming up the street.
explanation: Refers to a machine that moves snow
first_new_sentence: The gardener used a blower to clean up the leaves in the yard.
second_new_sentence: The main blower was for sale at the hardware store, offering great discounts.

sentence: Having sex is like poker if you dont have a good partner, you better have a good hand.
explanation: Refers to a part of the body
first_new_sentence: She raised her hand to ask a question during the lecture.
second_new_sentence: The winning hand at the poker game decided the champion of the tournament.

sentence: What do you call a discount circumcision? a rip off.
first_new_sentence: I felt a sharp rip in the fabric of my shirt as I moved awkwardly.
second_new_sentence: The rip in the pricing strategy caused confusion among the customers.

sentence: These jokes feature words that are spelled the same but have distinct contextual meanings in the humor. The new sentences use the respective meanings in serious contexts.
